page.title: 02INTRODUCTION (CONTINUED)
page.content: The towns near to Glamis, and in particular Dundee, provide much of the employment for people living in the area. Locally based employment is mainly on the farms or estate work. The hotels, shops, and the school provide some employment and there are a number of small businesses based in the area. There is a wide range of living standard in the area, from prosperous farmers to relatively poorly paid estate workers, and a moderate level of unemployment. Youth unemployment is a serious problem. There is a fairly strong sense of local identity, even among relatively recent settlers in the area. The school and to a much lesser degree the church provide focal points in the community.
